title: Next Steps
content:
Build habits that scale

  • Always work in a dedicated practice directory
  • Prefer man pages and --help
  • Use tab completion and history search
  • Learn to inspect before you modify (e.g., ls, cat, stat)

Mini-project

Create a folder, generate a few files, and write a one-line pipeline that counts how many lines contain a keyword.

cd ~/unix-cli-practice
mkdir -p mini
printf "one\nerror\ntwo\nerror\n" > mini/app.log
cat mini/app.log | grep -n "error" | wc -l
